oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance - Ted Jarrett Tribute - 2005-12-03 - tape one of two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tribute and performances honoring Ted Jarrett from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on December 3, 2005. Tape one of two. Program coincides with the publication of Ted Jarrett's biography You Can Make It If You Try.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Michael Gray; Levert Allison; Marion James; Charles "Wigg" Walker; Bobby Hebb; Johnny Jones; Earl Gaines; The Valentines (Musical group); Chris Scruggs; Rufus Hunter; Carolyn Mathis;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recording begins in progress. Opening comments by Michael Gray. Introductions of audience members. Band introductions. Performances include; You Can Make It If You Try (Levert Allison) -- I Understand (Levert Allison) -- I'm Just What You're Looking For (Marion James) -- Slave To Love (Charles "Wigg" Walker) -- Every Night In The Week (Bobby Hebb) -- Pipe Dreams (Band featuring Johnny Jones) -- Somebody Somewhere (Earl Gaines) -- The Door Is Still Open (Earl Gaines) -- Let's Sit Down And Talk Things Over (Earl Gaines) -- Hey, Hey, I Love You (Earl Gaines) -- It's Love Baby (24 Hours A Day) (Earl Gaines) -- Yesterday's Mistake (The Valentines) -- Love, Love, Love (Chris Scruggs) -- Teach Me (Rufus Hunter) -- Somewhere Back A Few Blocks From Here (Carolyn Mathis).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Gray, Michael; Allison, Levert; James, Marion; Walker, Charles; Hebb, Bobby; Jones, Johnny; Gaines, Earl; The Valentines (Musical group); Scruggs, Chris; Hunter, Rufus; Mathis, Carolyn; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
